head.supplied: Melbourne ¶ 27/1/74. ¶ Sir. ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acquaint you, that I returned last night from my phytographic journey through the Hume-River district and adjoining snowy mountains, my return havi...

div.p: E74/1052, unit 735, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to acquaint you, that I returned last night from my phytographic journey through the Hume-River district and adjoining snowy mountains, my return having been delayed for several days by the difficulty of crossing the alpine streams after the last heavy rains. I had an opportunity to institute numerous observations on the Victorian plants of that district, which I had never visited before, and I have added also to our collections of new and rare plants.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be, Sir,
